order book.translation[0].definitions[0]: a record of how many goods or services a company has been asked to provide, which shows how successful it is financially
Our order books are full at the moment.
order book.translation[1].definitions[0]: a book listing all the orders for goods or services a company has received; also used to talk about the orders themselves
The company said its order book now lists 742 planes.
It’s not the only business that can’t keep its order books filled.
